stateMeasures.title: Constitutional Amendment on Property Tax Assessment
stateMeasures.description: Would amend Article X, Section 6 of the South Carolina Constitution to cap annual property tax assessment increases at 3% for owner-occupied residential property, unless the property is sold or substantially improved.
proArguments: Provides predictable property tax costs for homeowners
Protects seniors and fixed-income residents from being priced out of their homes
Encourages long-term homeownership and neighborhood stability
conArguments: Could shift tax burden to new homebuyers and commercial properties
May reduce local government revenue for schools and services
Creates assessment inequities between similar properties

stateMeasures.title: Education Funding Reform Amendment
stateMeasures.description: Would amend Article XI of the South Carolina Constitution to establish a minimum per-pupil funding level for public schools, adjusted annually for inflation, and require the General Assembly to fund the full amount.
proArguments: Ensures consistent, adequate funding for all SC public schools
Reduces funding disparities between wealthy and poor school districts
Provides accountability for state education spending
conArguments: Limits legislative flexibility in budget priorities
May require tax increases or cuts to other programs
Does not guarantee improved educational outcomes

stateMeasures.title: Renewable Energy Standard Advisory Question
stateMeasures.description: Non-binding advisory question asking whether the General Assembly should require electric utilities to generate at least 30% of electricity from renewable sources by 2035.
proArguments: Promotes clean energy jobs and economic development
Reduces air pollution and public health costs
Positions SC competitively for federal clean energy incentives
conArguments: Could increase electricity costs for consumers and businesses
May not be technically or economically feasible in the timeframe
Advisory only - does not bind the General Assembly

measures.title: Richland County School Bond Referendum
measures.description: Authorizes Richland County School District One to issue up to $500 million in general obligation bonds to construct new schools, renovate existing facilities, and upgrade technology infrastructure throughout the district.

measures.title: Penny Tax Extension for Transportation
measures.description: Extends the existing one-cent transportation sales tax for an additional seven years to fund road improvements, public transit expansion, and pedestrian safety projects throughout Richland County.

measures.title: Charleston County Greenspace Preservation Bond
measures.description: Authorizes the issuance of $200 million in general obligation bonds to acquire and preserve natural areas, protect wetlands, and create new public parks and recreational facilities throughout Charleston County.

measures.title: Greenville County Library System Bond
measures.description: Authorizes the issuance of $75 million in general obligation bonds to construct a new main library facility, renovate branch libraries, and expand digital resources for the Greenville County Library System.

measures.title: Hospitality Fee Allocation Amendment
measures.description: Advisory question on whether to dedicate 25% of hospitality fee revenues specifically to beach renourishment, drainage improvements, and flood mitigation projects in coastal areas of Horry County.

measures.title: Spartanburg County Parks and Recreation Bond
measures.description: Authorizes the issuance of $45 million in general obligation bonds to develop new recreational facilities, upgrade existing parks, and construct multi-use trails connecting communities throughout Spartanburg County.
